pages.text: Xianguangia is a soft-bodied sea anemone looking animal from the Chengjiang Biota. It had a cylindrical body with a whorl of around 16 tentacles around the oral disc. The tentacles were feather like pinnules which meant it was probably adapted to a filter feeding lifestyle. It likely lived attached to the sea floor.
